meanings.definition: An enzyme that catalyzes the hydrolysis of disaccharides into monosaccharides.
meanings.sent1: The disaccharidase in our bodies helps break down sugars into simpler forms.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study how disaccharidase works to understand digestion better.
meanings.sent3: The disaccharidase at the party was the life of the enzyme dance floor.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to break down complex sugars was like a disaccharidase cutting through a sugar cube.
meanings.sent5: The disaccharidase enzyme is like a tiny sugar detective, solving the mystery of complex sugars.

meanings.definition: A protein that aids in the digestion of complex sugars in the small intestine.
meanings.sent1: In the small intestine, disaccharidase proteins help digest sugars efficiently.
meanings.sent2: The body relies on disaccharidase to process sugars for energy.
meanings.sent3: The disaccharidase protein told a sweet joke about sugar digestion.
meanings.sent4: Her disaccharidase functioned like a sugar-digesting superhero in the small intestine.
meanings.sent5: The disaccharidase protein works tirelessly to break down sugars, like a small intestine superhero.
